channel.title: Need help with port forwarding
channel.description: Well I know the main part of it all, really. I AM port forwarded, and I know how to get my no-ip host, and I know how to have the no-ip client and have it checked. But do I put the no-ip host into client.java of my client for people to connect? And if that's right, will it only work for me? Help pleasee, thanks community !

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @11j123 11j123
item.description:
@11j123 wrote:

[quote=“modzilla, post:4, topic:415799”]Your router probubly doesnt have 43594 open

So you have to go to 192.168.1.1 and type in user: admin pass: admin (usually) and open 43594. there are many guides on that[/quote]
Did you not even read what I said? I DO HAVE THE PORT I NEED OPEN. If I could I’d rep-- for just not reading it honestly…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Tobbescape Tobbescape
item.description:
@Tobbescape wrote:

[quote=“modzilla, post:4, topic:415799”]Your router probubly doesnt have 43594 open

So you have to go to 192.168.1.1 and type in user: admin pass: admin (usually) and open 43594. there are many guides on that[/quote]
There’s different IP’s for a router. He can check the ip to the router by going to “CMD” and typing in “ipconfig /all”

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @modzilla modzilla
item.description:
@modzilla wrote:

Your router probubly doesnt have 43594 open

So you have to go to 192.168.1.1 and type in user: admin pass: admin (usually) and open 43594. there are many guides on that

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @11j123 11j123
item.description:
@11j123 wrote:

[quote="`Java, post:2, topic:415799"]Search 127.0.0.1 and 0.0.0.0 in your client.java, change all of those to your no-ip.

save, compile, run[/quote]
I tried but then I can’t connect to the server… what do I do?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

Search 127.0.0.1 and 0.0.0.0 in your client.java, change all of those to your no-ip.

save, compile, run

Read full topic

Well I know the main part of it all, really. I AM port forwarded, and I know how to get my no-ip host, and I know how to have the no-ip client and have it checked.
